授業目的: This course analyzes the reality of the Japanese legal system from a socio-legal perspective. The analysis focuses especially on criminal justice and human rights issues in Japanese society from the perspective of international human rights law.
到達目標: Students will develop basic knowledge of the Japanese legal system and become familiar with some of the human rights issues including concrete examples of legislations and judicial cases in Japan.
特記事項: 【合併】総合日本学習科目（法制度）（CIEC）/Japanese Legal System　１（国際学部）
授業方法: Face-to-face format. Lecture followed by Q&A and associated active learning assignments. Students will be expected to have read the assigned materials before the class. In order to enhance learning outcomes, some of the sessions may conducted online partly or entirely, subject to relevant rules and regulations. Details will be provided via the LMS in acvance (at least one week before).

第2回: Overview of Japanese Law: Roppo(六法, Japanese Constitution and Other Major Legal Codes) and Judicial System
第3回:
Japanese Judicial System(continued)
Criminal Justice and Human Rights Issues: CAT
第6回: Exploring Japanese Legal Culture: How to Search Unique Legislations including Local Ordinances
第8回: International Human Rights Law and Japanese Legal System: Overview
第9回: International Human Rights in Japan(1): Two Covenants (ICCPR & ICESCR) and UPR
第10回: International Human Rights in Japan(2): CERD
第11回: International Human Rights in Japan(3): CEDAW
第12回: International Human Rights in Japan(4): CRC
第13回: International Human Rights in Japan(5): CRPD
トピック.授業外学習2: Topics will be adjusted according to the characteristics of the class as well as each student's state of knowledge and preparation.
